cards.name: Abyssal Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
cards.flavor:
"Open the gates, and bid them enter."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.name: Adarkar Sentinel
cards.text: {1}: Adarkar Sentinel gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We encountered the Sentinels in the wastes, near no living thing. Their purpose was inscrutable."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

cards.name: Adarkar Unicorn
cards.text: {T}: Add {U} or {1}{U} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to pay cumulative upkeep costs.
cards.flavor:
"There is no nobler creature in all of Terisiare."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

cards.name: Adarkar Wastes
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool. Adarkar Wastes deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Aegis of the Meek
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Target 1/1 creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"With this marvel, even the weak have a fighting chance!"
—Arcum Dagsson,
Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: Aggression
cards.text:
Enchant non-Wall creature
Enchanted creature has first strike and trample.
At the beginning of the end step of enchanted creature's controller, destroy that creature if it didn't attack this turn.
cards.flavor: The star that burns twice as bright burns half as long.

cards.name: Altar of Bone
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Altar of Bone, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for a creature card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Amulet of Quoz
cards.text:
Remove Amulet of Quoz from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.
{T}, Sacrifice Amulet of Quoz: Target opponent may ante the top card of his or her library. If he or she doesn't, you flip a coin. If you win the flip, that player loses the game. If you lose the flip, you lose the game. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Anarchy
cards.text: Destroy all white permanents.
cards.flavor:
"The Shaman waved the staff, and the land itself went mad."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

cards.name: Arctic Foxes
cards.text: Arctic Foxes can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or greater as long as defending player controls a snow land.
cards.flavor:
"Those Foxes are wily, swift, and ferocious. They are the warriors of the snows."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

cards.name: Arcum's Sleigh
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains vigilance until end of turn. Activate this ability only during combat and only if defending player controls a snow land.
cards.flavor:
"With the proper equipment and caution, one can travel anywhere."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: Arcum's Weathervane
cards.text:
{2}, {T}: Target snow land is no longer snow.
{2}, {T}: Target nonsnow basic land becomes snow.

cards.name: Arcum's Whistle
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Choose target non-Wall creature the active player has controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn. That player may pay {X}, where X is that creature's converted mana cost. If he or she doesn't, the creature attacks this turn if able, and at the beginning of the next end step, destroy it if it didn't attack. Activate this ability only before attackers are declared.

cards.name: Arenson's Aura
cards.text:
{W}, Sacrifice an enchantment: Destroy target enchantment.
{3}{U}{U}: Counter target enchantment spell.
cards.flavor:
"I have my faith, and I have my prayers. But if push comes to shove, I've also got a little something extra."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

cards.name: Armor of Faith
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Keep your chainmail, warrior. I have my own form of protection."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

cards.name: Arnjlot's Ascent
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{1}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The dreams of a child fulfilled:
The wind on my brow,
the air 'neath my feet."
—Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage

cards.name: Ashen Ghoul
cards.text:
Haste
{B}: Return Ashen Ghoul from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep and only if three or more creature cards are above Ashen Ghoul.

cards.name: Aurochs
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Aurochs attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Aurochs.
cards.flavor: One Auroch may feed a village, but a herd will flatten it.

cards.name: Avalanche
cards.text: Destroy X target snow lands.
cards.flavor:
"The pass was completely blocked by the avalanche; we're forced to turn back. Nevertheless, we've gone farther and seen more than any before us."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

cards.name: Balduvian Barbarians
cards.flavor:
"Barbarian raids were a concern to those living in the northwest provinces, but the Skyknights never dealt with the problem in a systematic way. They thought of the Balduvians as an ‘amusing model' of their forebears' culture."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

cards.name: Balduvian Bears
cards.flavor:
"They're a hardy bunch, but I'd still bet that they just slept through the worst of the cold times."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

cards.name: Balduvian Conjurer
cards.text: {T}: Target snow land becomes a 2/2 creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
cards.flavor:
"The very lands of Balduvia are alive."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

cards.name: Balduvian Hydra
cards.text:
Balduvian Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+0 counters on it.
Remove a +1/+0 counter from Balduvian Hydra: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Balduvian Hydra this turn.
{R}{R}{R}: Put a +1/+0 counter on Balduvian Hydra. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Balduvian Shaman
cards.text: {T}: Change the text of target white enchantment you control that doesn't have cumulative upkeep by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (For example, you may change "black creatures can't attack" to "blue creatures can't attack.") That enchantment gains "Cumulative upkeep {1}." (At the beginning of its controller's upkeep, that player puts an age counter on it, then sacrifices it unless he or she pays its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

cards.name: Barbarian Guides
cards.text: {2}{R}, {T}: Choose a land type. Target creature you control gains snow landwalk of the chosen type until end of turn. Return that creature to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Barbed Sextant
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice Barbed Sextant: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Baton of Morale
cards.text: {2}: Target creature gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor:
"The Goblins would kill to get ahold of this one."
—Arcum Dagsson,
Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: Battle Cry
cards.text:
Untap all white creatures you control.
Whenever a creature blocks this turn, it gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"In the thick of battle, you must keep your wits about you. Yelling a lot helps, too."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

cards.name: Battle Frenzy
cards.text:
Green creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
Nongreen creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"One day you, too, shall drink the blood of your foes. It is something to look forward to."
—Toothlicker Harj, Orcish Captain

cards.name: Binding Grasp
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Binding Grasp unless you pay {1}{U}.
You control enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature gets +0/+1.
cards.flavor:
"What I want, I take."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage

cards.name: Black Scarab
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked by black creatures.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as an opponent controls a black permanent.

cards.name: Blessed Wine
cards.text:
You gain 1 life.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"May the bounty of Kjeld enrich your days."
—Halvor Arenson,
Kjeldoran Priest

cards.name: Blinking Spirit
cards.text: {0}: Return Blinking Spirit to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Don't look at it! Maybe it'll go away!"
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

cards.name: Blizzard
cards.text:
Cast Blizzard only if you control a snow land.
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Creatures with flying don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

cards.name: Blue Scarab
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked by blue creatures.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as an opponent controls a blue permanent.

cards.name: Bone Shaman
cards.text: {B}: Until end of turn, Bone Shaman gains "Creatures dealt damage by Bone Shaman this turn can't be regenerated this turn."
cards.flavor:
Rattle me bones as I cross the floor
And the bones in your grave will rattle no more.

cards.name: Brainstorm
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"I reeled from the blow, and then suddenly, I knew exactly what to do. Within moments, victory was mine."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage

cards.name: Brand of Ill Omen
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Cumulative upkeep {R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Enchanted creature's controller can't cast creature spells.
cards.flavor:
"Let those who bear the brand receive no shelter, no kindness, and no comfort from our people."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

cards.name: Breath of Dreams
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Green creatures have "Cumulative upkeep {1}."
cards.flavor:
"Get up, blast you! They're attacking! Why are you all so slow?"
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

cards.name: Brine Shaman
cards.text:
{T}, Sacrifice a creature: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
{1}{U}{U}, Sacrifice a creature: Counter target creature spell.
cards.flavor:
"The Shamans of Marit Lage do her bidding in secret, but they do it gladly."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

cards.name: Brown Ouphe
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}: Counter target activated ability from an artifact source. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
cards.flavor:
"Ouphes love trinkets and love to take them apart. I only wish they wouldn't do so with the magical ones."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

cards.name: Brushland
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Brushland deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Burnt Offering
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Burnt Offering, sacrifice a creature.
Add X mana in any combination of {B} and/or {R} to your mana pool, where X is the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"My foes serve me twice: in dying, and in death."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.name: Call to Arms
cards.text:
As Call to Arms enters the battlefield, choose a color and an opponent.
White creatures get +1/+1 as long as the chosen color is the most common color among nontoken permanents the chosen player controls but isn't tied for most common.
When the chosen color isn't the most common color among nontoken permanents the chosen player controls or is tied for most common, sacrifice Call to Arms.

cards.name: Caribou Range
cards.text:
Enchant land you control
Enchanted land has "{W}{W}, {T}: Put a 0/1 white Caribou creature token onto the battlefield."
Sacrifice a Caribou token: You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Celestial Sword
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +3/+3 until end of turn. Its controller sacrifices it at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
"So great is its power, only the chosen can wield it and live."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

cards.name: Centaur Archer
cards.text: {T}: Centaur Archer deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Centaurs will kill our Aesthir if they can; they've always been enemies. Destroy the horse-people on sight."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

cards.name: Chaos Lord
cards.text:
First strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent gains control of Chaos Lord if the number of permanents is even.
Chaos Lord can attack as though it had haste unless it entered the battlefield this turn.

cards.name: Chaos Moon
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, count the number of permanents. If the number is odd, until end of turn, red creatures get +1/+1 and whenever a player taps a Mountain for mana, that player adds {R} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces). If the number is even, until end of turn, red creatures get -1/-1 and if a player taps a Mountain for mana, that Mountain produces colorless mana instead of any other type.

cards.name: Chromatic Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As Chromatic Armor enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Chromatic Armor enters the battlefield with a sleight counter on it.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature by sources of the last chosen color.
{X}: Put a sleight counter on Chromatic Armor and choose a color. X is the number of sleight counters on Chromatic Armor.

cards.name: Chub Toad
cards.text: Whenever Chub Toad blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
Chub Toad, Chub Toad
At the door.
Run away quick
Or you'll run no more.
—Traditional children's rhyme

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Black
cards.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
cards.text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Green
cards.text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Red
cards.text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: White
cards.text: {1}: The next time a white source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Clairvoyance
cards.text:
Look at target player's hand.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"As we followed the ice wall, we had the distinct feeling of being watched. Many of the party wanted to turn back."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

cards.name: Cloak of Confusion
cards.text:
Enchant creature you control
Whenever enchanted creature attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it assign no combat damage this turn. If you do, defending player discards a card at random.

cards.name: Cold Snap
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Cold Snap deals damage to that player equal to the number of snow lands he or she controls.
cards.flavor: Who knows from whence the winter comes?

cards.name: Conquer
cards.text:
Enchant land
You control enchanted land.
cards.flavor:
"Why do we trade with those despicable Elves? You don't live in forests, you burn them!"
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

cards.name: Cooperation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has banding. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor:
"The Elves train our healers, and we keep the Orcs at bay. Most Elvish bargains aren't as fair."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.flavor:
"The duel was going badly for me, and Zur thought I was finished. He boasted that he would eat my soul—but all he ate were his words."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage

cards.name: Crown of the Ages
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Attach target Aura attached to a creature to another creature.

cards.name: Curse of Marit Lage
cards.text:
When Curse of Marit Lage enters the battlefield, tap all Islands.
Islands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.flavor:
"Our world has not felt her thundering steps in lifetimes, but Marit Lage's presence is still with us."
—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran Priest

cards.name: Dance of the Dead
cards.text:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Dance of the Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Dance of the Dead." Put enchanted creature card onto the battlefield tapped under your control and attach Dance of the Dead to it. When Dance of the Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {1}{B}. If he or she does, untap that creature.

cards.name: Dark Banishing
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"Will not the mountains quake and hills melt at the coming of the darkness? Share this vision with your enemies, Lim-Dûl, and they shall wither."
—Leshrac, Walker of Night

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
cards.flavor:
"Leshrac, my liege, grant me the power I am due."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.name: Death Ward
cards.text: Regenerate target creature.
cards.flavor:
"Sometimes, a soul is not ready to complete its journey to the next world."
—Halvor Arenson,
Kjeldoran Priest

cards.name: Deflection
cards.text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.
cards.flavor:
Up and down,
over and through,
back around—
the joke's on you.

cards.name: Demonic Consultation
cards.text: Name a card. Exile the top six cards of your library, then reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal the named card. Put that card into your hand and exile all other cards revealed this way.

cards.name: Despotic Scepter
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target permanent you own. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"We were not meant to have such terrible things. They should be left where we found them, if not destroyed!"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

cards.name: Diabolic Vision
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on top of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"I have seen the true path. I will not warm myself by the fire—I will become the flame."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.name: Dire Wolves
cards.text: Dire Wolves has banding as long as you control a Plains. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor:
"It's amazing how scared a city kid can get at a dog. Now, of course, I'd cross Terisiare alone, and keep no watch if I had a pack of greys hanging on my flanks as I went."
—Oddveig Ulfsson, caravan scout

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"I implore you not to forget the horrors of the past. You would have us start the Brothers' War anew!"
—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

cards.name: Dread Wight
cards.text: At end of combat, put a paralyzation counter on each creature blocking or blocked by Dread Wight and tap those creatures. Each of those creatures doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as it has a paralyzation counter on it. Each of those creatures gains "{4}: Remove a paralyzation counter from this creature."

cards.name: Dreams of the Dead
cards.text: {1}{U}: Return target white or black creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. That creature gains "Cumulative upkeep {2}." If the creature would leave the battlefield, exile it instead of putting it anywhere else. (At the beginning of its controller's upkeep, that player puts an age counter on it, then sacrifices it unless he or she pays its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

cards.name: Drift of the Dead
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Drift of the Dead's power and toughness are each equal to the number of snow lands you control.
cards.flavor:
"Take their dead, and entomb them in the snow. Risen, they shall serve a new purpose."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.name: Drought
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Drought unless you pay {W}{W}.
Spells cost an additional "Sacrifice a Swamp" to cast for each black mana symbol in their mana costs.
Activated abilities cost an additional "Sacrifice a Swamp" to activate for each black mana symbol in their activation costs.

cards.name: Dwarven Armory
cards.text: {2}, Sacrifice a land: Put a +2/+2 counter on target creature. Activate this ability only during any upkeep step.
cards.flavor:
"Few of us left, now. Confounded Yeti have opened all the vents. We'd best hide here with the weapons."
—Perena Deepcutter,
Dwarven Armorer

cards.name: Earthlink
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Earthlink unless you pay {2}.
Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller sacrifices a land.

cards.name: Earthlore
cards.text:
Enchant land you control
Tap enchanted land: Target blocking creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only if enchanted land is untapped.
cards.flavor:
"Even the ground is our friend."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

cards.name: Elder Druid
cards.text: {3}{G}, {T}: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor:
"I am older than any Elder Druid before me, and still no child has been born with the Mark to take my place. When will the wheel turn?"
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

cards.name: Elemental Augury
cards.text: {3}: Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order.
cards.flavor:
"It is the changing of perception that is important."
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

cards.name: Elkin Bottle
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Exile the top card of your library. Until the beginning of your next upkeep, you may play that card.

cards.name: Elvish Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. If that creature is green, prevent the next 2 damage instead.
cards.flavor:
"The Kjeldorans keep the Orcs at bay and we train their healers. Most human bargains aren't as fair."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

cards.name: Enduring Renewal
cards.text:
Play with your hand revealed.
If you would draw a card, reveal the top card of your library instead. If it's a creature card, put it into your graveyard. Otherwise, draw a card.
Whenever a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return it to your hand.
cards.flavor: That which lasts longest serves best.

cards.name: Energy Storm
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt by instant and sorcery spells.
Creatures with flying don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

cards.name: Enervate
cards.text:
Tap target artifact, creature, or land.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Worlds turn in crucial moments of decision. Make your choice."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage

cards.name: Errant Minion
cards.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay any amount of mana. Errant Minion deals 2 damage to that player. Prevent X of that damage, where X is the amount of mana that player paid this way.
cards.flavor: Abandon not your faith when others abandon you.

cards.name: Errantry
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+0 and can only attack alone.
cards.flavor:
"There is no shame in solitude. The lone Knight may succeed where a hundred founder."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

cards.name: Essence Filter
cards.text: Destroy all enchantments or all nonwhite enchantments.
cards.flavor:
"Freyalise has cleansed our bodies and minds of the plagues of Kjeldor; all she asks in return is that we keep pure our newly given home in Fyndhorn."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

cards.name: Essence Flare
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -0/-1 counter on that creature.
cards.flavor: Never underestimate the power of the soul unleashed.

cards.name: Essence Vortex
cards.text: Destroy target creature unless its controller pays life equal to its toughness. A creature destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Masters who sacrifice for servants will receive the gift of loyalty.

cards.name: Fanatical Fever
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Let go your fury, and hone your anger. Become the fist of Freyalise!"
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

cards.name: Fear
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"Even the bravest of warriors yet knows the dark clutch of fright upon his stalwart heart."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.name: Fiery Justice
cards.text: Fiery Justice deals 5 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players. Target opponent gains 5 life.
cards.flavor: "The fire of justice burns like nothing else." —Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian Chieftain

cards.name: Fire Covenant
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Fire Covenant, pay X life.
Fire Covenant deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.

Flying

—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi Heretic

cards.name: Sleight of Mind
cards.text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (For example, you may change "target black spell" to "target blue spell." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

cards.name: Snow Devil
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Enchanted creature has first strike as long as it's blocking and you control a snow land.
cards.flavor: "Give me wings to fly and speed to strike. In return, the glory I earn shall be yours." —Steinar Icefist, Balduvian Shaman

cards.name: Snow Fortress
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{1}: Snow Fortress gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{1}: Snow Fortress gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{3}: Snow Fortress deals 1 damage to target creature without flying that's attacking you.

cards.name: Snow Hound
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Return Snow Hound and target green or blue creature you control to their owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"If you're starving, eat your horses, your dead, or yourself—but never eat your dog."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

cards.name: Snowblind
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -X/-Y. If that creature is attacking, X is the number of snow lands defending player controls. Otherwise, X is the number of snow lands its controller controls. Y is equal to X or to enchanted creature's toughness minus 1, whichever is smaller.

cards.name: Snowfall
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {U} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Whenever an Island is tapped for mana, its controller may add {U} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces). If that Island is snow, its controller may add {U}{U} to his or her mana pool instead. Spend this mana only to pay cumulative upkeep costs.

cards.name: Soldevi Golem
cards.text:
Soldevi Golem doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may untap target tapped creature an opponent controls. If you do, untap Soldevi Golem.
cards.flavor: Slow and steady wins the race.

cards.name: Soldevi Machinist
cards.text: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to activate abilities of artifacts.
cards.flavor:
"Perhaps this time the power of the artificers shall be used wisely."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: Soldevi Simulacrum
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
{1}: Soldevi Simulacrum gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
They look human—
until they bleed.

cards.name: Songs of the Damned
cards.text: Add {B} to your mana pool for each creature card in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Not wind, but the breath of the dead.

cards.name: Soul Barrier
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, Soul Barrier deals 2 damage to that player unless he or she pays {2}.
cards.flavor:
"There's more than one way to skin an Ouphe—or thwart a mage."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran Royal Mage

cards.name: Soul Burn
cards.text:
Spend only black and/or red mana on X.
Soul Burn deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more than the amount of {B} spent on X, the player's life total before Soul Burn dealt damage, or the creature's toughness.

cards.name: Soul Kiss
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{B}, Pay 1 life: Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than three times each turn.

cards.name: Spectral Shield
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and can't be the target of spells.
cards.flavor:
"What can be a stronger shield than concealment? Have you ever defeated an enemy you didn't know existed?"
—Gerda Äagesdotter,
Archmage of the Unseen

cards.name: Spoils of Evil
cards.text: For each artifact or creature card in target opponent's graveyard, add {1} to your mana pool and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Virtue has its rewards, as does its opposite."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.name: Spoils of War
cards.text:
X is the number of artifact and/or creature cards in an opponent's graveyard as you cast Spoils of War.
Distribute X +1/+1 counters among any number of target creatures.
cards.flavor:
"This is the fun part!"
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

cards.name: Staff of the Ages
cards.text: Creatures with landwalk abilities can be blocked as though they didn't have those abilities.
cards.flavor:
"We found this staff useful on our visit to this very commission. Would Relicbane prefer we had been slain by Lim-Dûl's horrors?"
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: Stampede
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We could see the horizon blacken with the great beasts, but it was too late. The icefield offered no immediate safety, but luckily most of us reached a crevasse in which we could take cover."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

cards.name: Stench of Evil
cards.text: Destroy all Plains. For each land destroyed this way, Stench of Evil deals 1 damage to that land's controller unless he or she pays {2}.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor:
"May the forces that took Argoth beneath the waves never come among us again."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: Stone Spirit
cards.text: Stone Spirit can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"The spirit of the stone is the spirit of strength."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

cards.name: Stonehands
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Trust in the power of stone. Stone is strong; stone shatters swords; stone breaks bones. Trust in stone."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

cards.name: Storm Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Storm Spirit deals 2 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor:
"Come to us, with your lightning. Come to us, with your thunder. Serve us with your strength, and smite our foes with your power."
—Steinar Icefist, Balduvian Shaman

cards.name: Stormbind
cards.text: {2}, Discard a card at random: Stormbind deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"Once, our people could call down the storm itself to do our bidding."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

cards.name: Stromgald Cabal
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target white spell.
cards.flavor:
"Kjeldor must be supreme at any cost."
—Avram Garrisson, Leader of the Knights of Stromgald

cards.name: Stunted Growth
cards.text: Target player chooses three cards from his or her hand and puts them on top of his or her library in any order.

cards.name: Sulfurous Springs
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool. Sulfurous Springs deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Sunstone
cards.text: {2}, Sacrifice a snow land: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.flavor:
"I dispute Relicbane's hysterical allegations, Commissioner, but it is true that these artifacts can be dangerous."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.
cards.flavor:
"The so-called Barbarians will not respect us for our military might—they will respect us for our honor."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

cards.name: Tarpan
cards.text: When Tarpan dies, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"A good Tarpan will serve you, faithful and true. A bad one will kick you in the head."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

cards.name: Thermokarst
cards.text: Destroy target land. If that land was a snow land, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Finally we understand the lesson of our home: loss begets renewal."
—Kolbjörn, Elder Druid of the Juniper Order

cards.name: Thoughtleech
cards.text: Whenever an Island an opponent controls becomes tapped, you may gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"A resourceful mage has many sources of information. The best one is your foe."
—Zur the Enchanter

cards.name: Thunder Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
{U}: Thunder Wall gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The Lemures had barely taken wing when the sky roared with thunder. The swarm of little beasts wavered, divided, and fell, crashing to the earth."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox

cards.name: Timberline Ridge
cards.text:
Timberline Ridge doesn't untap during your untap step if it has a depletion counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a depletion counter from Timberline Ridge.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool. Put a depletion counter on Timberline Ridge.

cards.name: Time Bomb
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a time counter on Time Bomb.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice Time Bomb: Time Bomb deals damage equal to the number of time counters on it to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Tinder Wall
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Add {R}{R} to your mana pool.
{R}, Sacrifice Tinder Wall: Tinder Wall deals 2 damage to target creature it's blocking.

cards.name: Tor Giant
cards.flavor:
"What do you do then? Run. Run very fast. Don't stop until you see the camp—or a bigger Giant."
—Toothlicker Harj,
Orcish Captain

cards.name: Total War
cards.text: Whenever a player attacks with one or more creatures, destroy all untapped non-Wall creatures that player controls that didn't attack, except for creatures the player hasn't controlled continuously since the beginning of the turn.

cards.name: Touch of Death
cards.text:
Touch of Death deals 1 damage to target player. You gain 1 life.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"What was yours is mine. Your land, your people, and now your life."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer

cards.name: Touch of Vitae
cards.text:
Until end of turn, target creature gains haste and "{0}: Untap this creature. Activate this ability only once."
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Trailblazer
cards.text: Target creature can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Our Elvish Hunter Taaveti led us swiftly along hidden paths through the dense forest. We caught the Orcs from behind, and completely by surprise."
—Lucilde Fiksdotter, Leader of the Order of the White Shield

cards.name: Underground River
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool. Underground River deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Updraft
cards.text:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"The power of flight has but one equal in battle: surprise. Understanding how to use both is the key to victory."
—Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage

cards.name: Urza's Bauble
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Urza's Bauble: Look at a card at random in target player's hand. You draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Veldt
cards.text:
Veldt doesn't untap during your untap step if it has a depletion counter on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a depletion counter from Veldt.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool. Put a depletion counter on Veldt.

cards.name: Venomous Breath
cards.text: Choose target creature. At this turn's next end of combat, destroy all creatures that blocked or were blocked by it this turn.

cards.name: Vertigo
cards.text: Vertigo deals 2 damage to target creature with flying. That creature loses flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I saw the wizard gesturing, but I didn't guess his plan until my Aesthir cried out and went into a dive."
—Arna Kennerüd, Skyknight

cards.name: Vexing Arcanix
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target player names a card, then reveals the top card of his or her library. If it's the named card, the player puts it into his or her hand. Otherwise, the player puts it into his or her graveyard and Vexing Arcanix deals 2 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Vibrating Sphere
cards.text:
As long as it's your turn, creatures you control get +2/+0.
As long as it's not your turn, creatures you control get -0/-2.
cards.flavor:
"Unearthly and invisible fibers emanate from this sphere, entangling all who draw near."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: Walking Wall
cards.text:
Defender
{3}: Walking Wall gets +3/-1 until end of turn and can attack this turn as though it didn't have defender. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor:
"The fortress is not what it seems."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: Wall of Lava
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{R}: Wall of Lava gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Now there's something you don't see every day."
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

cards.name: Wall of Pine Needles
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{G}: Regenerate Wall of Pine Needles.
cards.flavor: The power of the forest takes a hundred forms. Some are more surprising than others.

cards.name: Wall of Shields
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Banding (If any creatures with banding you control are blocking a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by.)
cards.flavor:
"It's the pokey bits that hurt the most."
—Ib Halfheart, Goblin Tactician

cards.name: War Chariot
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I wouldn't advise using it with a Woolly Mammoth, but it's quite appropriate for many other beasts."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: Warning
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target attacking creature this turn.
cards.flavor:
"The folk of the Karplusan Mountains are impossible to ambush."
—Lovisa Coldeyes,
Balduvian Chieftain

cards.name: Whalebone Glider
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target creature with power 3 or less gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"It's no Ornithopter, but then I'm no Urza."
—Arcum Dagsson, Soldevi Machinist

cards.name: White Scarab
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked by white creatures.
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as an opponent controls a white permanent.

cards.name: Whiteout
cards.text:
All creatures lose flying until end of turn.
Sacrifice a snow land: Return Whiteout from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Wiitigo
cards.text:
Wiitigo enters the battlefield with six +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on Wiitigo if it has blocked or been blocked since your last upkeep. Otherwise, remove a +1/+1 counter from it.

cards.name: Wild Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
cards.flavor:
"Here in Fyndhorn, where Freyalise's power is strongest, the forest has its own opinion."
—Laina of the Elvish Council

cards.name: Wind Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
Wind Spirit can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
cards.flavor:
"To visit the sky requires bravery, and thought, and little else. To master the sky requires the binding of its masters, and little else."
—Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage

cards.name: Wings of Aesthir
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has flying and first strike.
cards.flavor:
"For those of courage, even the sky holds no limit."
—Arnjlot Olasson, Sky Mage

cards.name: Winter's Chill
cards.text:
Cast Winter's Chill only during combat before blockers are declared.
X can't be greater than the number of snow lands you control.
Choose X target attacking creatures. For each of those creatures, its controller may pay {1} or {2}. If that player doesn't, destroy that creature at end of combat. If that player pays only {1}, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this combat.

cards.name: Withering Wisps
cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Withering Wisps.
{B}: Withering Wisps deals 1 damage to each creature and each player. Activate this ability no more times each turn than the number of snow Swamps you control.

cards.name: Woolly Mammoths
cards.text: Woolly Mammoths has trample as long as you control a snow land.
cards.flavor:
"Mammoths may be good to ride on, but they're certainly bad to fall off of!"
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

cards.name: Woolly Spider
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Woolly Spider blocks a creature with flying, Woolly Spider gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We need not fear the forces of the air; I've yet to see a Spider without an appetite."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, Elvish Hunter

cards.name: Word of Blasting
cards.text: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated. Word of Blasting deals damage equal to that Wall's converted mana cost to the Wall's controller.
cards.flavor:
"Walls? What walls?"
—Jaya Ballard, Task Mage

cards.name: Word of Undoing
cards.text: Return target creature and all white Auras you own attached to it to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor:
"It was in Urza's journals that I finally found the secret at the core of the summonings."
—Journal, author unknown

cards.name: Wrath of Marit Lage
cards.text:
When Wrath of Marit Lage enters the battlefield, tap all red creatures.
Red creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
cards.flavor: Dread Marit Lage lies dreaming, not dead.

cards.name: Yavimaya Gnats
cards.text:
Flying
{G}: Regenerate Yavimaya Gnats.
cards.flavor:
"It is our third day of travel on the Yavimaya River, and still these creatures plague us. Davin Lansson, our naturalist, has facetiously labeled them ‘gnats,' and the name has stuck."
—Disa the Restless, journal entry

cards.name: Zur's Weirding
cards.text:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, he or she reveals it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.

cards.name: Zuran Enchanter
cards.text: {2}{B}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.
cards.flavor:
"We are Kjeldorans no more."
—Zur the Enchanter

cards.name: Zuran Orb
cards.text: Sacrifice a land: You gain 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"I will go to any length to achieve my goal. Eternal life is worth any sacrifice."
—Zur the Enchanter

cards.name: Zuran Spellcaster
cards.text: {T}: Zuran Spellcaster deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"A mage must be precise as well as potent; cautious, as well as clever."
—Zur the Enchanter
